intro: Mirbelia ringrosei, commonly known as the Ringrose Mirbelia, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive ring-like arrangement of leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in spherical inflorescences. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough, hairy texture. Mirbelia ringrosei is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
